intro: Cyphostemma stegosaurus, commonly known as the African star vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dense forests or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses worldwide.
